intro: Heptapleurum morobeanum, commonly known as the Morobean evergreen, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and compact growth habit. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are elliptical, glossy, and arranged alternately along the stems. Heptapleurum morobeanum produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, adding ornamental value to its appearance.
